summary: The document comprises confidential and secret communications concerning the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, featuring letters and routing sheets. These documents highlight Sergyj Czornonoh's claims of having alerted American officials to Lee Harvey Oswald's assassination plans in 1963. Additionally, they detail Czornonoh's allegations of subsequent harassment and torture by police and intelligence services, alongside mentions of coordination with the FBI and other agencies. Czornonoh also made predictions regarding the assassination of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., implicating James Earl Ray.
key_findings: Sergyj Czornonoh claimed to have warned American officials about Lee Harvey Oswald's intentions to assassinate President Kennedy in 1963.
Czornonoh's warnings were allegedly not taken seriously by some officials, leading to claims of harassment and torture by police and intelligence services.
The documents reference coordination with the FBI and other agencies concerning Czornonoh's information.
Czornonoh also predicted the assassination of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., naming James Earl Ray in connection with the event.
